hive_text_custom.text:
: So Meg, we are talking about animals; do
                                you like to go to the zoo?
: I love to go to the zoo.

: Okay. So when you go to the zoo, what
                                animals do you like to watch?

: I really like to watch giraffes. Giraffes
                                are so tall and giraffes look really soft and friendly,
                                so I wish that I could touch a giraffe someday.

: Oh, that's so true. There is a zoo near my
                                house in California, and you can walk up some stairs and
                                then you can

the giraffes, and their face is the
                                same height as your face, and they look really, really
                                cute. Yeah, giraffes are great.

: Giraffes are so cute. Maybe someday, I can
                                feed the giraffes.

: I like how giraffes look. I love their
                                face. And I also love camels, also because I think
                                camels have a similar face. They look really cool.
: I don't think camels are very cute.

: Yeah. They're so hairy. Camels have so much
                                hair that they look ugly.

: Oh really. I like camels. They always look
                                cool and relaxed.

: They do look relaxed, but I like giraffes
                                better than camels.
: Well, what about llamas? Llamas are

camels and they're kind of like giraffes. They
                                kind of have the same face. Do you like llamas?

: I think llamas look cute but I've heard
                                that llamas aren't very friendly.

: No. Actually, I think I heard camels do
                                that but maybe llamas do it, too.

: Okay. So what about other animals? What
                                other animals do you like at the zoo?

: I really like the zebras because zebras are
                                black and white with stripes. So the zebra stripes are
                                really cool, and zebras are similar to horses. So
                                sometimes I think I could ride a zebra if I had one.

: Yeah. That would be cool. Zebras do look
                                pretty cool. Are there any other animals?

: Well, there's one animal that I'm afraid
                                of, and that's a bear.

: Bears are really scary and they're so big
                                with huge teeth and giant

, and I feel like a bear
                                would eat me if I met it in person.
: Actually, have you seen a bear

: No. I have never seen a bear in the wild,
                                and I really don't want to.

: Well, in California, sometimes you can see
                                bears in the wild, small black bears. And actually, the
                                black bears are not that dangerous.

: Yeah. I mean, you need to be careful when
                                you see a black bear in the wild, but they almost never
                                attack anybody. So the one animal you must be afraid of
                                though, is the mountain lion. So there are mountain
                                lions also in California, and they are scary.

: Hmm, so maybe I should avoid mountain
                                lions, too.

: Yeah. If you walk in the wild and you see
                                a mountain lion, maybe it's too late. You're already
: Maybe I'll just keep going to the zoo.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 1) There's a zoo near Todd's house in _____.
2) Meg doesn't like camels because they're _____.

hive_text_custom.text: Their face is the same height as your face.
We use height to measure how tall things are and weight to measure how heavy thing are. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
My height is 178 cm.
 My dad and I are the same height.

hive_text_custom.text: Have you heard about llamas spitting at people                                    before?
You spit with your mouth, by pushing out food or liquid quickly. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
I spit out my food because it tasted bad.
 It is not polite to spit in public.

hive_text_custom.text: Zebras are black and white with stripes.
Stripes are lines that are spaced by different colors. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Tigers and zebras have stripes.
 My shirt had blue and red stripes.

hive_text_custom.text: I have never seen a bear in the wild.
The phrase in the wild refers to being in nature where there is no human development. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
I would love to live in the wild.
 Lots of animals live in the wild.

hive_text_custom.text: They're so big with huge teeth and giant claws.
Claws are the sharp nails on animals such as cats and dogs. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
The bears have big claws.
 Cats' claws are very sharp.

hive_text_custom.text: Llamas are kind of like camels.
We often use the phrase kind of like or sort of like to compare similar things. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Seattle is sort of like San Francisco.
 Grapefruits are sort of like oranges.
